description: Rumi Daravaja is a famous historical landmark in the city of Lucknow, India.
The Dr. Babasaheb Ambedkar Memorial Park in Lucknow is a fitting tribute to one of India’s most important historical figures.
The Chota Imambara in Lucknow is a beautiful example of Mughal architecture and one of the city’s most popular tourist attractions.
The Husainabad Clock Tower, which stands near the Rumi Darwaza and was completed in 1881, is India's tallest clock tower
Also called the Residency and the Residency Complex, the British Residency is a complex of buildings that once served as the residence of the British Resident General
When you are in the mood for some aquatic fun, head off to Amrapali Water Park, one of the best water parks in Lucknow.
One of the best places to shop in Lucknow is the Aminabad Market, which has been in operation since the times of the Nawabs
The Hazratganj Market, a century-old shopping area located in the heart of Lucknow, is where you can find the city’s vibrant soul.
A visit to the Indira Gandhi Planetarium must be on your list of things to do in Lucknow, especially if you are a science enthusiast or traveling with your kids.

place: Nawab Wahid Ali Shah Zoological Garden
description: Nawab Wahid Ali Shah Zoological Garden, more popularly known as Lucknow Zoo, is counted among the best places to visit in Lucknow for nature lovers and family holidaymakers
The state museum that is located within the Lucknow Zoo is another key attraction you can include in your Lucknow itinerary.
Gomti Riverfront Park has been one of the main tourist places in Lucknow ever since its establishment, thanks to its pristine location and scenic surroundings
When you want to witness the architectural grandeur of the British era, you must make a visit to the Constantia House.
